table.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: The logical name of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

description.value: This extension allows for the indication of the status of a recommendation in the context of an updated guideline version along with an optional explanatory text

purpose.value: The RecommendationReviewStatus extension is used to indicate whether a recommendation has been added, updated, reviewed, or reaffirmed in the new guideline version, as well as to add an explanation text related to the status.

short.value: Version status of recommendation, i.e., confirmed, updated or new

definition.value: Indicates the status of a recommendation in the context of a newer version of the guideline.

comment.value: Supports tracking how a recommendation evolved in the new version of the guideline. That is, whether it was reviewed in the light of current evidence and confirmed or update, or is new entirely.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://build.fhir.org/extensibility.html) for a list).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
